### Revised Parameter Settings

The nature of the training data indicated that instead of changing the model parameters, a much better result could be reached by chnaging the data itself and leave the model parameters as they have been running in the first time. Generally if the data needs to be changed, then the model parameters should not be changed, because that would make it impossible to compare the results by knowing what change had the most impact on them.
